block.p: Elisabeth Suzanne Topel, a daughter of Sandra Topel and Dr. Howard Topel of Deerfield, Ill., was married yesterday evening at her parents' house in Reedsburg, Wis., to John Anthony Galotto, the son of Mary Kay Galotto and Dr. John Galotto of Potomac, Md. Commissioner Leo Grill of Sauk County Family Court officiated at the ceremony, which was led by Justice Seymour Simon, who retired from the Illinois Supreme Court and is a great-uncle of the bride.

Mrs. Galotto, 29, is a law student at the University of Chicago. She graduated from the University of Michigan and received a master's degree in social policy from the London School of Economics. Her father is an obstetrician and gynecologist in Park Ridge, Ill.

Elisabeth Suzanne Topel, a daughter of Sandra Topel and Dr. Howard Topel of Deerfield, Ill., was married yesterday evening at her parents' house in Reedsburg, Wis., to John Anthony Galotto, the son of Mary Kay Galotto and Dr. John Galotto of Potomac, Md. Commissioner Leo Grill of Sauk County Family Court officiated at the ceremony, which was led by Justice Seymour Simon, who retired from the Illinois Supreme Court and is a great-uncle of the bride.

Mrs. Galotto, 29, is a law student at the University of Chicago. She graduated from the University of Michigan and received a master's degree in social policy from the London School of Economics. Her father is an obstetrician and gynecologist in Park Ridge, Ill.

Mr. Galotto, 33, is an associate in the Chicago office of Piper Marbury Rudnick & Wolfe, a law firm. He graduated from Johns Hopkins University and received his law degree from Columbia. His mother is the provost of Montgomery College in Rockville, Md. His father is an internist with Suburban Primary Care Physicians in Bethesda, Md.
